articles.title: Julia Parish
articles.description: Natural Resource Specialist & aspiring Environmental Data Scientist
articles.contents:
Contents

Education
Master of Environmental Data Science | June 2022
 Bren School of Environmental Science & Management
 University of California, Santa Barbara
Bachelor of Arts in Interdisciplinary Studies: Environmental Studies | May 2007
 University of Hawaii at Manoa
Master’s Capstone Project
Snow Today, 01/22 to 06/22Role: Communications Manager | Client: UCSB Earth Research Institute 
- Developed an interactive R Shiny web application to visualize snow cover and albedo data to expand data availability of remotely sensed snow data. 
- Created data analysis, processing, and visualization tutorials in Python and wrote technical documentation to educate users on remotely sensed snow condition data.
Experience
USAG Presidio of Monterey | Monterey, CA Natural Resources Manager | 12/22 to Present
Center for Conservation Biology - UC Riverside | Riverside, CA Data Science Fellow | 07/22 to 09/22
American Conservation Experience | San Diego, CA
- Restoration Specialist | 04/20 to 07/21
- Director | 06/18 to 04/20
Catalina Island Conservancy | Avalon, CA Plant Conservation Manager | 04/15 to 07/18
Oahu Invasive Species Committee | Honolulu, HI Director | 12/12 to 04/15
Center for Conservation Research and Training at the University of Hawaii | Honolulu, HI and Papahanaumokuakea National Marine Monument CCRT Field Project Support Assistant | 07/10 to 12/12
Center for Environmental Management of Military Lands | Hilo, HI
- Botanist (Research Assistant I) | 11/08 to 06/09
- Incipient Weed Control Biologist (Research Assistant II) | 07/09 to 07/10
Oahu Invasive Species Committee | Honolulu, HI
- Outreach Specialist | 12/07 to 11/08
- Field Technician (AmeriCorps) | 12/06 - 11/07
Undergraduate Research
Organization for Tropical Studies | La Selva Biological Station, Puerto Viejo de Sarapiqui, Costa Rica National Science Foundation and Duke University Research Education for Undergraduates Research Fellow | 06/06 - 08/06
Objective: Independent research study to detect secondary metabolites in ethnobotanically important plant species.
Certifications & Licenses
Drone Camp – University of California Agriculture & Natural Resources, 2022 Cartography - ESRI MOCC, 2022 Adult Mental Health First Aid - Mental Health First Aid USA, 2021 Diversity & Equity Training – Cream City Conservation & Consulting, 2021 California Qualified Applicator License – CA Department of Pesticide Regulation, 2017Brown Treesnake Rapid Response Team - United States Geological Services, 2014
Skills
Programming Languages: R, Python, SQL, familiar with HTML and CSSSoftware: Anaconda Navigator, ESRI (ArcGIS, ArcGIS Pro), R Studio, Git, GitHub, Jupyter Lab, Jupyter Notebook, Binder, Google Earth Engine, Tableau Desktop, Tableau Prep, pgAdmin, QGIS, Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, Zoom, Prezzi, Wix, Visual Studio CodeProject Management: Github Issues, Asana, Basecamp, Podio, Slack, Trello, Clockify, Zotero, Zenhub
Publications & Articles
Gaynor, K., Azevedo, T., Parish, J., et al. (2022). Ten simple rules to cultivate belonging incollaborative data science research teams. PLOS Computational Biology. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1010567 
Duffy, D., Parish, J., et al. (2015). Has the Small Indian Mongoose Become Established on Kauai Island, Hawaii? Pacific Science, 69(4), 559-565. https://doi.org/10.2984/69.4.9 
Mazurkiewicz, D., Parish, J., et al. (2017). Restoration and Protection of the Archipelago’s Flora and Habitats: A New Era. Fremontia, 45(3), 26. Parish, J. (2010). Targeting Pohakuloa’s “Most Un-Wanted”: The Incipient Weed Program at PTA. Ecosystems Management Program Bulletin, 48, 4-6.
Presentations & Posters
Parish, J. “Implementing an Early Detection Program on Catalina Island: Prioritizing Landscaped Grasses” Poster. Island Invasives Symposium. Dundee, Scotland. 2017. Parish, J. “Prioritizing Miconia calvescens Survey on Oahu” Presentation. California Invasive Plant Council Symposium, San Diego, CA. 2015. 
Saunter, M., Nimz, I., Worcester, N., Vanderlip, C., Parish, J., Marie, A. “Adapting Habitat Management to a Newly Colonized Indigenous Plant on Kure Atoll” Poster. Hawaii Conservation Conference. Honolulu, HI. July 2013.Parish, J. “The Incipient Weed Program at Pohakuloa Training Area, Hilo, HI” Poster. Hawaii Conservation Conference. Honolulu, HI. 2010. 
Professional Affiliations
Board Member, Secretary, President | California Invasive Plant Council 2017 – 2021Member | California Native Plant Society 2016 – PresentMember | Society for Ecological Restoration 2019 – 2021Member | San Diego County Weed Management Area 2018 – 2021

Julia Parish

            Biography
            I recently graduated from the Master’s in Environmental
            Data Science program at the Bren School of Environmental
            Science & Management at the University of California,
            Santa Barbara. Since graduating from the University of
            Hawaii at Manoa with a B.A. in Environmental Studies, I have
            led field teams to enhance biological diversity, ecosystem
            health, and cultural and recreational resources on islands
            in the Pacific region and throughout Southern California.
            While working at Pohakuloa Training Area on Hawaii Island, I
            developed and implemented an invasive plant early detection
            and rapid response program, which involved establishing data
            collection and mapping standards. This experience solidified
            my passion for collecting and maintaining tidy data. I am an
            experienced Program Director with expertise in project
            management, spatial analysis, and invasion biology. My
            career objective is to focus on aiding land managers and
            conservation organizations with developing management
            priorities using current data science tools and climate
            change models. When not working, I can be found in the
            ocean, playing capoeira, or volunteering on a remote atoll
            surrounded by thousands of seabirds.
            
            
            Education
            Bren School for Environmental Science &
            Management | Santa Barbara, CA     Master of
            Environmental Data Science | June 2022
            The University of Hawaii at Manoa |
            Honolulu, HI     Bachelor of Arts in Environmental
            Studies | May 2007

              Biography
              I recently graduated from the Master’s in Environmental
              Data Science program at the Bren School of Environmental
              Science & Management at the University of California,
              Santa Barbara. Since graduating from the University of
              Hawaii at Manoa with a B.A. in Environmental Studies, I
              have led field teams to enhance biological diversity,
              ecosystem health, and cultural and recreational resources
              on islands in the Pacific region and throughout Southern
              California. While working at Pohakuloa Training Area on
              Hawaii Island, I developed and implemented an invasive
              plant early detection and rapid response program, which
              involved establishing data collection and mapping
              standards. This experience solidified my passion for
              collecting and maintaining tidy data. I am an experienced
              Program Director with expertise in project management,
              spatial analysis, and invasion biology. My career
              objective is to focus on aiding land managers and
              conservation organizations with developing management
              priorities using current data science tools and climate
              change models. When not working, I can be found in the
              ocean, playing capoeira, or volunteering on a remote atoll
              surrounded by thousands of seabirds.
